sentences.en: In any event, it is easy to overrate what the internet did for Mr Obama.
sentences.cn: 无论如何, 高估网络为奥巴吗所作的一切是很容易的.

sentences.en: It is easy to overrate their importance.
sentences.cn: 人们易于过分强调它们的重要性.

sentences.en: Let your friends underrate your advantage, while let your enemies overrate your disadvantage.
sentences.cn: 让朋友低估你的优点, 让敌人高估你的缺点.

sentences.en: M: Overrate . biochemically . no different than eating large quantities of chocolate.
sentences.cn: ‘爱’往往被人夸大,在生物作用中,仅仅用一块巧克力就能达到相同的效果.

sentences.en: More men are finding out that the joys of work have been overrated.
sentences.cn: 更多的男士正发现工作的种种乐趣被高估了。

sentences.en: Original intention: Person cannot overrate force.
sentences.cn: 原意: 人不可不自量力.

sentences.en: Some teachers have a tendency to overrate the abilities of obedient, conscientious children.
sentences.cn: 一些老师有喜欢对那些听话, 谨慎的孩子的倾向.

sentences.en: That's why you need to have the discipline not to overrate your own judgment.
sentences.cn: 所以,你要有规律,不能高估本身的判断.

sentences.en: The truck drew in to one side and allowed us to overrate it.
sentences.cn: 卡车开到一边让我们超过它.

sentences.en: When they first start working on something, they overrate their achievements.
sentences.cn: 当他们刚开始做某一件事时, 他们高估了自己的成就.

sentences.en: You should on no account overrate the enemy's combat effectiveness.
sentences.cn: 切不可过分估计敌人的战斗力.

words.tran_cn: 对…定价过高；定价高于…的购买力

trans.tran_cn: 对…估价过高， 对…评价过高
trans.tran_en: If you say that something or someone is overrated, you mean that people have a higher opinion of them than they deserve

trans.tran_cn: 对（质量、能力等）估价过高
trans.tran_en: If you say that something or someone is overrated, you mean that people have a higher opinion of them than they deserve
